body_html:
@hughperkins there is no clinfo instruction in my mac, what can I do for it? But I can compile the test code here for opencl with clang and result the following info:
clang -framework OpenCL dumpcl.c -o dumpcl && ./dumpcl Device Intel(R) Core(TM) i5-5257U CPU @ 2.70GHz supports OpenCL 1.2 Device Intel(R) Iris(TM) Graphics 6100 supports OpenCL 1.2
body_text:
@hughperkins there is no clinfo instruction in my mac, what can I do for it? But I can compile the test code here for opencl with clang and result the following info:
clang -framework OpenCL dumpcl.c -o dumpcl && ./dumpcl Device Intel(R) Core(TM) i5-5257U CPU @ 2.70GHz supports OpenCL 1.2  Device Intel(R) Iris(TM) Graphics 6100 supports OpenCL 1.2
body:
@hughperkins there is no `clinfo` instruction in my mac, what can I do for it? But I can compile the test code [here](http://stackoverflow.com/questions/7892955/how-can-i-test-for-opencl-compability) for opencl with clang and result the following info:
`clang -framework OpenCL dumpcl.c -o dumpcl && ./dumpcl
Device Intel(R) Core(TM) i5-5257U CPU @ 2.70GHz supports OpenCL 1.2 
Device Intel(R) Iris(TM) Graphics 6100 supports OpenCL 1.2`
